nodes.title: Start Highres Fix from nth Step
Batch Range Note
widgets_values:
LCM - As lcm uses under 10 steps, you 2x input the batch range and image resolution. 

Batch Range - How much images you want to render in a single queue.

It also Controls the number of empty latent images for Ksampler

Use Exact Number of images you want to render.

Don't Use "0" as it also provides for Latent Image for ksampler else it will break.

TIP: Use at least 10 frames for testing else it will give you noisy image.


---------------------- 

BUG: If you are rendering images in batches because of low specs, After each Batch the Images will change even after same seed, so it can't be helped. 

SOLUTION: Render it in one go or longer batches, it will take hours to render, put some ice on the graphic card for faster result :D ( You can minimize this bug by specifying the minute details in prompts) or 
Fix in Davinci Deflicker - Flora Light (Masking the duration only of the sudden change), 
Also See the tip in Note Near the Ksampler node.

--------------------

BUG 2: I have 8GB graphics so max frames I can render in a single go is around 150 

If I go beyond that, the ksampler will show like its rendering but will not actually render.

If your GPU is not melting then your ksampler is stuck, try reducing the batch range then try melting again :)

nodes.title: Skip Frames Note
widgets_values:
Skip Frames - After Each Queue, skip the "total" of rendered frames. 
(Give some rest to the computer so it does not catch fire, don't be cruel)

Eg:
 
1st Queue- Batch Range 60 | Skip Frames 0  | Rendered 60 
2nd Queue- Batch Range 60 | Skip Frames 60 | Rendered 60
3rd Queue- Batch Range 60 | Skip Frames 120 (60+60)...
and so on... till your batch size.

Input your last batch correctly. 

Warning: Ksampler can stuck if your input batch range is greater than the source images.

Eg : I have my last batch of 55 images left but I input 60 images in batch range then the ksampler got stuck. 
Then I put 55 as my batch range then it worked. Hurraah!



Tip: In the input box, basic Maths can be done inside comfyui only not need of calculator. 

Eg : if I put "200-50" (250 minus 50) in the input, it will calculate to 150 automatically, like wise other basic Maths

nodes.title: HigheRes Fix | Detail Enhancer | AD Macro Motion
widgets_values:
Total Sampler Steps: Total Number of steps for ksampler. (Default value - 10) 

Stop raw at nth step: Raw sampler will stop at this step.  (Default Value - 6)

HighRes Fix Upscale - It upscales the Latent - (value around 1.1 - 1.4 is good, above 1.5 no change is observed)
(Default Value - 1.2 which is good, it will be enhanced in the refiner workflow)

Start Highres Fix from nth step: Higres fix sampler will start at this step and continue till the total sampler steps. (Default Value - 5)


----------------------
Steps Theory: 
 
Total Steps - 10 iterations.
Raw Steps - First 6 Iterations.
High Res Steps - From 5th to 10th iteration. (1 overlapping iteration for good blending)  
__________________________________________________________________________________________________
__________________________________________________________________________________________________


Detail Enhancer - It injects noise in the model, use up to max value of 20 - Higer values cause micro details into morphing/sliding. (Default value is 2) 

AD Macro Motion - AnimateDiff motion of Background Elements is controlled by this value. Use up to max value of 10. Higer values cause jittering/Choppy motion. Min value 1 is for normal motion (Default Value - 3 for stable elements, almost no motion)

*Higer value above 10 till 1000 in AD Macro Motion gives ghosting like Echo images, can be cool for some abstract effects. Sometimes it becomes like deforum img2img animation with consistent jittering background. Try different values for fun. 

*Higer Values than 10 till 200 in macro motion can sometimes experimentally give perfectly still background with good details and good character consistency, you need to find your x value.

nodes.title: LCM Sampler Step and CFG
widgets_values:
Sampler CFG - Use Between 1 - 9, Higher values causes artifacts, color noise, and weird backgrounds. Default value is 3. 

Use Lower 1-5 for Realistic Models and 3-7 for anime/cartoon.

LCM Lora Strength - 0.65 seems good, you can experiment with higher values, also balance CFG and steps.




-------------------------------

*When Background gets messy, use low cfg for good backgrounds.

*Value of cfg below 4 causes some faded look. You can experiment with 

1) LCM Lora Strength 
2) Sampler Steps
3) Sampler CFG 

All three are dependent on each other.

nodes.title: ControlNet 1
widgets_values: F:\#Projects\1) SD Animation\15) Anime Tell me\OpenPose

nodes.title: ControlNet Important Note
widgets_values:
* Lower Strength and End Percent can lead to creative results which will reduce the original image look (Applicable in Softedge, Canny, Depth, and LineArt Pass) and give more stylized look, close resemblance to the prompts.

* Greater Start percent around 0.3-0.5 tends to create a still image from the main prompt first and then an artifact character overlayed on it.  This Can be used for Abstract creation.

nodes.title: OUT OF MEMORY ERROR
widgets_values:
If you got out of memory Error while it reaches the above sampler, then See the "Requested Memory:  xx MB" in the red error box.

If that xx memory requested is below 1GB then just queue the prompt again, the workflow will just run fine. It will take CPU's Ram to Render. 

If it's above 1GB then lower the Resolution and then queue to run it smoothly.

Loras -

2)  Saturation Tweaker - https://civitai.com/models/71192/saturation-tweaker-lora-lora
Add Saturation ( 0.3- 0.7) when getting less contrast. 

3) Detail Slider  -  
https://civitai.com/models/58390/detail-tweaker-lora-lora 
https://civitai.com/models/153562/detail-slider-lora
Use Negative Values if getting weird details in High CFG value

4) Blue theme- https://civitai.com/models/102153/blue-theme
Use Loras like this which control background to get more better backgrounds.

nodes.title: CheckPoint
widgets_values:
Checkpoint - Try Different Checkpoints for creative (results:0.95) 


To use Lora - add the Lora in the loras stack

If your renders are glitchy or incomplete, it may be lora incompatible with AnimateDiff Loader or You have some problem in the Prompts.

Beta_Scheldule: It only works with sqrt_linear(AnimateDiff)

nodes.title: AnimateDiff
widgets_values:
Model - motionModel_v01 and Temporaldiff-v1-animatediff was seen to produce best results.
Context Length to 16
----------------------------
motionModel_v01 - https://civitai.com/models/139237?modelVersionId=154097

Temporaldiff - https://huggingface.co/CiaraRowles/TemporalDiff/tree/main
* Temporal Diff can sometime give yellow tint to the final image, which can be fixed in post using curves>playing with the blue channel.


Feel free to test out other motion models.

nodes.title: Prompt Note
widgets_values:
*Positive Prompt: Write as usual, specify minute details, the elements are usually changed during the render, also you can try to use same keywords multiple times but same meaning ( Eg: blue jeans, blue color jeans, jeans of blue color) to reduce major changes. 

Using the word multiple times increase it's strength.
Avoid writing multiple color words. A prompt which has "black" keyword written x3 will darken the image x3


If you weight the keywords like "(this:1.9), it may produce glitchy result. Avoid high weights.

*Negative Prompt: Write as usual, Sometimes Negative prompts causes noise in images, try reducing the use of embeddings if you encounter them.

nodes.title: Tutorial Link
widgets_values: Collection of Documented v3.0 Tutorials: https://www.patreon.com/collection/321458

nodes.title: ControlNet 3
widgets_values: F:\#Projects\1) SD Animation\15) Anime Tell me\Frames

nodes.title: 4) Bug List
widgets_values:
1) Out of Memory error, after reaching the Ksampler node
Cause: Your PC is Running out of Vram of the Graphic Card. 
◉ Solution:
A) Just Queue Prompt again, sometimes it fixes the error, because it has already cached through the model loaders. (If you have an 8gb graphic card)  
B) Batch Range is too high, try lowering it (150-200 in one batch should be fine)
C) Resolution is too high, you can upscale later also... (use lower than 1000x1000)  
D) The SD model you are using is very big in size, it takes up ram. Use different SD model. 
E) This workflow is not tested on SDXL models because of it's vram consumption, So avoid SDXLs.

2) Rendered output frames are smudgy or incomplete. 
Cause: Experimental Technology. Sometimes it works, sometimes don't.  
◉ Solution: 
A) Try lowering the batch size, the details get smushed along the frames. Lower batch range (20-50) has the highest details. 
B) Your Prompt has weightings like -->(this:1.7)<-- remove this weighting. 
C) Negative Embeddings sometimes messes things up. Try isolating them one by one.   

  

4) Ksampler is stuck, it's rendering but not progressing. 
◉ Solution: 
A) If you do not hear the Phooooo... or Pheeeeee sound of the graphic card in a minute after when the green box hits the Ksampler node, that means it's stuck. You need to low down the batch range. It's too much to handle at once, so it handles none. Lower the batch range size.

B) You have 40 images left in the last batch but the batch range is set to 50. So 50-40 is 10. This extra 10 images can stuck the KSampler.

C) The Images leaks into CPU memory and render the extra images with CPU taking longer time.
Go into Task Manager > Performance > GPU and see the "Shared GPU memory" If it's greater than 0.1 then the images are leaking into CPU, CPU can handle well upto 1GB of Shared GPU, greater than that it's super slow to render. 

5) I rendered out fine, but it's not looking what it should be
◉ Solution: 
A) You might have mixed the passes in the control net unit. Check if Openpose passes are going in the openposemodel model. And like wise for the softedge, canny... and others.
B) Try changing Lora and models, also prompts can affect upto a great extent. 

6) I have the same Seed but the transition images of the batches are not same and creates a sharp change.
◉ Solution: Well the v2 version of this workflow includes IP adaptor and IP2P controlnet, by which it should be minimized, 
BTW this sharp change will not be noticeable after the Refiner Pass

nodes.title: Author's Note
widgets_values:
1) All Colored Nodes are Inputs and require your attention.   



2) Control Net Passes are already rendered to save time, you need to have them before using this workflow, Extract them using the Provided #1 ControlNet_Passes_Export.json file  

3) If Faces are not Looking good, it's fine, the refiner and face fix pass will take care of it 

4) Use value at least "10" in batch range to test render out your animation before final render. Lower than 10 frames may result in noisy images.


5) Use Link Render Mode to straight lines in ComfyUI Settings (Gear Icon in the right of the Queues Box) so the workflow doesn't look like spaghetti. 


◉ VIDEO TUTORIAL LINK 

https://youtu.be/qczh3caLZ8o



Google Drive Link for all versions of this Workflow : https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1HoZxKUX7WAg7ObqP00R4oIv48sXCEryQ?usp=sharing


I post my workflows, tutorials and secret techniques without any cost on my Patreon, just click "join for free" and sign up click "skip the payment" and you will be part of my journey for free.
Patreon link: patreon.com/jerrydavos


if you want to share your artwork with me, feel free to contact me on Discord - ID: jerrydavos 
or gmail : davos.jerry+contactai@gmail.com 
I will be very happy to see your works <3 



-----------------------------------------------------------------

INSTALLATION: 

 
*LCM LORA : https://civitai.com/models/195519?modelVersionId=225222 or huggingface.co/latent-consistency/lcm-lora-sdv1-5/tree/main

In ComfyUI Manager > click Install Missing Nodes.


*Update all the nodes, if you have already installed previously, especially Animatediff Evolved for LCM to work Properly
*Restart Comfyui to install the remaining dependencies 
*Drag and drop this workflow again, so it's default value loads properly.


-------------AnimateDIff Checkpoints-----------

Go to Manager > Install Models and search for them.

1) Temporaldiff-v1-animatediff - https://huggingface.co/CiaraRowles/TemporalDiff/tree/main
2) motionModel_v01 - https://civitai.com/models/139237?modelVersionId=154097

Put in  ComfyUI\custom_nodes\ComfyUI-AnimateDiff-Evolved\models

------------------------------------------------------------

*Minimum Requirement to run AnimateDiff is Nvidia RTX cards with at least 8GB.

Node Workflow by
Jerry Davos
davos.jerry+contactai@gmail.com

nodes.title: Highlighted Updates
widgets_values: All updates from now onwards will be highlighted with Colored groups.

nodes.title: #2 Animation Raw - LCM v3.0
widgets_values:
HOW TO USE: 

1) Choose Model checkpoint you want to use
2) Enter Width and Height of your Output Image 
3) Choose Positive Prompts, you want to see in the output
4) Choose Loras, (You have to experiment which looks good or not)
5) Paste the Passes Directories in ControlNets (1 and 2) Loaders and set their models and weight (See Neon Purple note) also you can use CN mask for dynamic animated background.

To Use the Masking feature, you should have masks available from #1_1 Extra Passes file or rotoscoped them from somewhere.

6) Paste The Directory where you want to save the Images in the Output Save Directory Node
7) Select Batch Range (Number of images you want to render in one Queue)
8) Choose LCM, Highres and AD Motion Settings, Default is good but experimental (See note)

9) [Optional] Choose Special feature - IP, Prompt Travel, Sparse if you want. (Notes will be available Besides them)
 

10) After every batch you can increase the batch naming for organizing the batches.
11) After every queue increase the skip frames to the Total number of images rendered already.
12) After All the batches are rendered it's Ready for #3 LCM Refiner workflow

*Don't Use Overlapping Technique in this phase, Use that in the final refiner phase, 
 
*Special Features are separated in different files due to technical limitation, if combined in one file it will give dimensions errors if used in parallel :D


________________________________________

Main Download Folder Link : https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1HoZxKUX7WAg7ObqP00R4oIv48sXCEryQ?usp=sharing
_________________________________________


Update Log: Version 3.0 - Jan 24

1) Added Cn Masking for more dynamic image control.
2) Added Prompt Travel feature


________________________________________

Update Log: Version 2.1 - Dec 23 

1) Added Detail Enhance, AD Macro Motion, Highres Fix.
2) Improved Control Nets node placements, settings and naming.

________________________________________


Update Log: Version 2 - Dec 23 

1) The weird color bleed/tint in the final images is removed by LCM technique (Found Experimentally) in this workflow. 

*A yellow tint may be observed (In low cfg) with TemporalDiff model in the final output which can be removed easily in post processing by using curves > blue channel >playing with the curve.   

2) LCM now supported, will have 2x - 3x Render speed with higher batch range input, as lcm uses under 10 steps, you 2x input the batch range and image resolution. 

3) Added Batch Number Naming for organizing
4) Added Output Save Location Path
5) Added bunch of custom nodes for more efficiency and organizing. (See installation List)

___________________________________________


* If Faces are not Looking good, or some weird but small artifacts, it's fine, the refiner pass will take care of it
* In prompts experiment with extreme words, and also test with loras with low strength. 
* Background still has weird artifacts. Play with sampler cfg (1-6) to see some change.
* IP adaptor produces messy results with LCM

nodes.title: ControlNet 3 - Notes
widgets_values:
1) Enable the CN 3 from the blue node, and Ummute the group below to use the ControlNet. 
2) Enter the Directory and use like normal 


Tips: 

1) Additional use of SoftedgePlus Pass from the #1_1 Extra Passes file can also improve consistency with Low End Percent (0.6 - 0.85) and weight (0.8 - 0.9) because it has some overall white noise in the image. 

2) Put the Original Frames directory in this tip. Using Ip2p or tile controlnet with low Weight (around 0.4), start percent (around 0.2) and end percent (around 0.5) can also improve stability of colors and details. If your aim is original look but stylized.

nodes.title: File Name + Special Feature
widgets_values: #2_0 - Raw Animation with Prompt Travel and Controlnet 3

nodes.title: Softedge, Canny, Lineart
widgets_values:
Stronger Strength and End Percent results in floating artifacts and Alien objects in Softedge, Canny, or lineArt Models

You can experiment with depth also.

nodes.title: Traveller Note
widgets_values:
*Enable the Traveller from above blue node, and Unmute the prompt travel group to use it, 

*First box is the changing prompt box formatted as - 
 "Frame Number" : "Changing Keyword",

*Second Box is the Normal positive prompt box, enter the text which will not change throughout the frames

*Third box is optional, ignore it. 
_________________________________________________________

1) Frame Number: Use at least 15 - 20 frames increase for a noticeable change.
2) Changing Keyword: Use minimum words (2-10) here, large sentences may give token error. 

3) Make Sure there is a comma in the last to separate the keyframes
For Eg- 

"0" :" Nature ",
"50" :" Ocean, Water",
"100" :"Fire",
"150" :"Nature"
 
150th key frame has no comma in the end.
